svmodt 0.1.0

    • Constructing Oblique Trees with svmodt

    Build an Oblique Decision Tree Using SVM Splits

    svm_split.Rd

    Constructs a decision tree where each internal node uses a Support Vector Machine (SVM) to determine the split. Supports dynamic feature selection, feature penalization, scaling, and class weighting.

    svm_split(
  data,
  response,
  depth = 1,
  max_depth = 3,
  min_samples = 5,
  max_features = NULL,
  feature_method = c("random", "mutual", "cor"),
  max_features_strategy = c("constant", "random", "decrease"),
  max_features_decrease_rate = 0.8,
  max_features_random_range = c(0.3, 1),
  penalize_used_features = FALSE,
  feature_penalty_weight = 0.5,
  used_features = character(0),
  class_weights = c("none", "balanced", "balanced_subsample", "custom"),
  custom_class_weights = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  all_classes = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing predictors and response.

    response

    A string specifying the response column name in `data`.

    depth

    Integer, current recursion depth (used internally).

    max_depth

    Maximum depth of the tree.

    min_samples

    Minimum number of samples required to split a node.

    max_features

    Maximum number of features to consider at a split.

    feature_method

    Feature selection method: "random", "mutual", or "cor".

    max_features_strategy

    Strategy to adjust max features: "constant", "random", "decrease".

    max_features_decrease_rate

    Decrease rate if `max_features_strategy = "decrease"`.

    max_features_random_range

    Numeric vector, min and max fraction if `max_features_strategy = "random"`.

    penalize_used_features

    Logical; if TRUE, penalize features used in ancestor nodes.

    feature_penalty_weight

    Numeric weight for penalization (0–1).

    used_features

    Character vector of features already used in ancestor nodes (internal use).

    class_weights

    How to handle class imbalance: "none", "balanced", "balanced_subsample", "custom".

    custom_class_weights

    Optional named vector of custom class weights.

    verbose

    Logical; if TRUE, prints node info during recursion.

    all_classes

    Optional character vector of all possible response classes (internal use).

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to underlying SVM fitting function.

    Value

    A nested list representing the decision tree. Each node contains:

    is_leaf

    Logical, TRUE if the node is a leaf.

    model

    Fitted SVM model at the node (for internal nodes).

    features

    Selected features at this node.

    scaler

    Scaling information for the node.

    left

    Left child node (decision > 0).

    right

    Right child node (decision ≤ 0).

    depth

    Depth of the node.

    n

    Number of samples at the node.

    max_features_used

    Maximum features used at this node.

    penalty_applied

    Logical, whether feature penalties were applied.

    class_weights_used

    Class weights applied at this node.

    Details

    This function recursively splits the dataset using an SVM at each node, stopping according to maximum depth, minimum samples, or pure nodes. Features can be selected randomly, by mutual information, or by correlation, and previously used features can be penalized to encourage diversity. The tree supports scaling of numeric features and flexible class weighting schemes.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data(iris)
tree <- svm_split(
  data = iris,
  response = "Species",
  max_depth = 3,
  min_samples = 5,
  feature_method = "random",
  verbose = TRUE
)
print_svm_tree(tree)
} # }
